title: Sloppy USMNT performances to blame as U.S. loses yet another Gold Cup final to Mexico
content: The USMNT's first chance to win a trophy under coach Mauricio Pochettino slipped away as they played poorly against Mexico in the Gold Cup final.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Mexico takes down USMNT to win 10th Gold Cup
content: Edson √Ålvarez's second-half header gave Mexico a 2-1 win over the United States and a 10th Gold Cup title in a frenetic final at Houston's NRG Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

title: Bellinger rescues Yankees to avoid Subway sweep
content: Cody Bellinger started a pivotal double play and the Yankees stopped a six-game losing streak by beating the Mets 6-4 to avoid a weekend Subway Series sweep.

title: Durant to Rockets part of NBA-first 7-team trade
content: A series of moves going back to Kevin Durant's trade to the Houston Rockets before the draft ultimately became the first seven-team trade in NBA history.

title: Cowboys All-Pro KR Turpin arrested on 2 charges
content: Cowboys All-Pro kick returner KaVontae Turpin was arrested Saturday by the Allen (Texas) Police Department and is facing two misdemeanor charges.

title: Sources: Nuggets expect Valanciunas to honor deal
content: The Denver Nuggets have informed Jonas Valanciunas ' representatives that the franchise fully expects the center to honor his contract, sources said.

title: Pirates CF Cruz makes 105.2 mph throw to plate
content: Pirates center fielder Oneil Cruz made a 105.2 mph throw to nab Seattle's J.P. Crawford at the plate on Sunday, the second-hardest thrown ball to produce an outfield assist since Statcast started tracking in 2015.

title: üèà Fantasy football sleepers, busts and breakouts
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: Los Angeles Sparks troll Sophie Cunningham's comments on Detroit, Cleveland after win
content: Earlier in the week, the Indiana Fever guard said she didn't know how excited players would be to play in two of the WNBA's three latest expansion cities.

title: Three rookies, five first-time honorees highlight All-Star roster
content: Indiana and Seattle each put three players on the All-Star Game roster, which also includes a trio of rookies.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Norris on British GP final lap: Don't mess it up
content: As Lando Norris closed in on home victory at the British Grand Prix, he had one overriding thought in his head: "Just don't f--- it up."

title: Musiala fractures left leg in Donnarumma collision
content: Bayern Munich said Jamal Musiala faces a "lengthy" recovery from a left leg fracture after his collision with PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma.

title: Mart√≠n Zubimendi joins Arsenal from Sociedad
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of highly rated Spain midfielder Mart√≠n Zubimendi from Real Sociedad, the Premier League club have announced.

title: Spain on favourites tag: 'Don't mention that word'
content: Spain defender Olga Carmona said there is no mention of the word favourites as they prepare to face Belgium in the European Championship on Monday.

title: Norway on brink of Euros QF after Finland win
content: A late solo strike by Norway forward Caroline Graham Hansen secured a 2-1 victory against Finland in the Women's European Championship on Sunday, as the twice champions took a big step towards qualifying for the quarterfinals.

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: Madrid's Gonzalo living a 'dream' at CWC
content: Real Madrid forward Gonzalo Garc√≠a said he is a living a "dream" at the FIFA Club World Cup after earning comparisons to the club's legendary former striker, Raul, with four goals in five games for Los Blancos.

title: Gonzalo Garc√≠a proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo Garc√≠a could be the reason they go all the way.

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: PSG passed one of their most difficult tests of the Club World Cup, overcoming two red cards in 2-0 win over Bayern Munich.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Hosts Switzerland keep knockout hopes alive
content: Switzerland's win over Iceland has them on course for the knockouts. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: Belgium's record scorer Wullaert ready to lead from the front vs. Spain
content: Belgium face Spain knowing their Euro 2025 could be over before it begins, but captain and record scorer Tessa Wullaert is used to doing things the hard way.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Le√£o
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Le√£o from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gy√∂keres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Brics backs India line on Pahalgam & UNSC reforms, slams tariffs
content: The Brics summit in Rio saw strong condemnation of the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Member nations urged concerted action against UN-designated terrorists. They also supported comprehensive reform of the UN Security Council. India joined Brics in criticizing attacks on Iran. The declaration expressed grave concern about the situation in the Occupied Palestinian territory.

title: 'It's ridiculous': Donald Trump mocks Musk's 'America Party'; calls him a 'train wreck'
content: Donald Trump dismissed Elon Musk's newly launched "America Party" as "ridiculous," reaffirming his belief in the traditional two-party system. Trump's remarks followed Musk's unveiling of the party, intended to challenge the perceived "one-party system" in the United States. The Tesla CEO's move came after a public fallout with Trump over federal spending cuts.

title: '100-year catastrophe': Nearly 80 killed in Texas flash floods - What we know so far
content: Devastating flash floods in Texas have resulted in at least 79 fatalities and numerous missing individuals, including children, during the Fourth of July holiday. President Trump declared it a "100-year catastrophe" and plans to visit the affected areas. Rescue efforts are intensifying as forecasters predict more heavy rain, with officials warning of a rising death toll across the flood-stricken state.

title: Watch | 'Where is my favourite journalist?': Gill‚Äôs witty reply leaves everyone in splits
content: Shubman Gill's witty response to a pre-match question about India's Edgbaston record highlighted the team's confidence after their historic 336-run victory over England. This win, India's first Test triumph at the venue, leveled the series 1-1. Gill emphasised the team's belief in their ability to win the series, dismissing the significance of past records and focusing on their current momentum.

title: Israel strikes Houthi targets in Yemen; Iran-linked weapon sites bombed
content: Early Monday, the Israeli military confirmed airstrikes on Houthi-linked sites across several Yemeni ports, including Hodeidah and Ras Issa. The IDF stated the strikes targeted locations used for attacks on Israel and threats to global shipping in the Red Sea. Key targets included the seized merchant ship 'Galaxy Leader' and the Ras Qantib power plant, allegedly used for military activities.

title: Microsoft exits Pakistan after 25 yrs; former country head reacts; calls it more than just business
content: After 25 years, Microsoft is reportedly exiting Pakistan, a move confirmed by the founding head of Microsoft Pakistan, Jawwad Rehman, via a LinkedIn post. The company commenced operations in June 2000 but has gradually reduced its presence.

title: 'Going to be sending letters': Trump pushes last-minute trade deals
content: President Trump announced that letters regarding upcoming trade deals, including one with India, would be sent out starting Monday. These actions precede the July 9 deadline, after which a 26% import duty could be imposed on goods entering the US.

title: History at Edgbaston! Gill breaks Gavaskar's 49-yr-old record, becomes youngest to ...
content: Shubman Gill, at 25, became India's youngest Test captain to secure an overseas victory, leading the team to a historic 336-run win against England at Edgbaston. Gill's exceptional batting, including scores of 269 and 161, fueled India's triumph. The victory, India's first at Edgbaston, leveled the series 1-1, marking a significant moment under Gill's leadership as they head to Lord's.

title: Condemning terror should be principle, not convenience: PM Modi
content: At the Brics summit, PM Modi passionately advocated for reforming global institutions and strongly condemned terrorism, emphasizing that it should be condemned as a principle, not a convenience. He highlighted the Pahalgam attack as a blow to humanity and urged a unified stance against terrorism, stressing that supporting terror should have consequences.

title: GitHub CEO to engineers: 'Smartest' companies will hire more software engineers, not less as‚Ä¶
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

title: Bilawal Bhutto's extradition 'offer' sparks LeT row
content: Bilawal Bhutto's offer to extradite Pakistani terrorists to India has sparked outrage, particularly from Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. Talha condemned Bhutto's remarks as an "irresponsible offer," demanding instead the extradition of Indian leaders and accusing Bhutto's family of aligning with Western and Indian narratives against Pakistan.

title: Will Jasprit Bumrah play at Lord's? Shubman Gill's one-word answer says it all
content: India levelled the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 1-1 with a massive 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston, marking their first-ever Test win at the venue. Debutant Akash Deep shone with a 10-wicket haul, while captain Shubman Gill led from the front with impressive batting performances.

title: Pakistan honours 'Kargil hero' whose body it refused to accept
content: Pakistan's army chief honored Captain Karnal Sher Khan, a Kargil war "martyr," despite initially refusing to accept his body after it was found on Tiger Hill. India stated that Pakistan denied acknowledging its army's involvement in Kargil, refusing to identify Khan to conceal their role and disservice the families of their soldiers.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: Officials can also rely on field inquiry for inclusion of names in Bihar rolls: EC
content: Amidst controversy over Bihar's electoral roll revision, the Election Commission clarifies that electors can submit documents after initial forms and that Electoral Registration Officers (EROs) can use alternative proofs beyond the listed documents for inclusion. Congress alleges a BJP conspiracy to deprive Bihar voters, while the EC defends the process, citing extensive consultations and adherence to guidelines.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par': Aamir Khan starrer performs impressively on Sunday, inches closer to 150 cr
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D‚ÄôSouza's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' continues its box office success, earning over Rs. 6.25 crore on its third Sunday. Despite competition, the film's total domestic collection nears Rs. 150 crore, standing at Rs 148.80 Cr. The movie experienced a surge in occupancy, particularly during evening shows, highlighting its enduring appeal.

title: Govt officials balk at interfering in ex-CJI home row
content: The Supreme Court has requested the government to reclaim the official bungalow of former CJI D.Y. Chandrachud, located at 5, Krishna Menon Marg. Officials are optimistic that the matter will be resolved amicably, avoiding the need for an eviction notice. Chandrachud's family is reportedly preparing to move out soon.

title: NBA trade buzz: Warriors eye $27M Heat star; Kuminga key in deal?
content: Jonathan Kuminga's future with the Golden State Warriors is uncertain as trade rumors swirl. He's expected to meet with interested teams in Las Vegas amid speculation of a potential deal. The Miami Heat are a possible destination, with discussions involving a sign-and-trade for Kyle Anderson, aiming to bolster both teams with strategic additions and future assets.

title: Russell Wilson's wife Ciara proves she‚Äôs still the ultimate style icon
content: Ciara recently captivated fans with a retro-inspired look, sporting a pink Adidas tracksuit and debuting a striking new hairstyle, drawing admiration from her husband, Russell Wilson. The singer has been making fashion headlines, from Knicks games to London trips. Simultaneously, Ciara is gearing up for her album release, 'CiCi,' on August 22, featuring collaborations with Normani and Teyana Taylor.

title: Was Yung Miami warning Cardi B the whole time? Stefon Diggs drama explodes online
content: Cardi B has removed all traces of Stefon Diggs from her Instagram account. This action has fueled speculation about a breakup. Fans are recalling a past warning from Yung Miami. Miami had previously labeled Diggs a "hoe" in a tweet. This tweet is now seen as a warning to Cardi B. Cardi B and Diggs were rumored to be dating. Fans believe Cardi B ignored red flags. The internet is buzzing with theories about the split. Some suggest Diggs was a rebound after Offset. The situation remains unconfirmed. Fans are closely watching for further developments.

title: Odisha: For reel, 12-year-old lies on track under passing train; RPF lodges FIR
content: In Odisha's Boudh district, the Railway Protection Force (RPF) has filed a case against two minor boys for performing a dangerous stunt on railway tracks. A video surfaced showing a 12-year-old lying between the tracks as a train passed, filmed by his 15-year-old friend.

title: India was confident of Pahalgam consensus
content: India approached the Brics summit with confidence in its ability to navigate competing interests and secure condemnation of the Pahalgam attack. Bolstered by its economic growth and digital infrastructure, India aimed to leverage its enhanced standing to address terrorism and promote multilateral institutional reform.

title: SC opens up staff jobs for OBC and SC/ST blocs, 'omits' EWS
content: CJI B R Gavai, has updated Supreme Court rules to include reservations for SCs, STs, OBCs, the physically challenged, ex-servicemen, and dependents of freedom fighters in direct subordinate staff recruitment. The amendment, gazetted on July 3rd, notably omits reservation for the Economically Weaker Section (EWS), despite its constitutional validity being upheld by the Supreme Court in a prior judgment.

title: Condemning terrorism should be our 'principle', not just 'convenience': PM Modi at Brics Summit
content: At the 17th BRICS Summit in Rio de Janeiro, Prime Minister Modi urged decisive global action against terrorism, condemning the Pahalgam attack as an assault on humanity. He advocated for urgent reforms in international institutions, highlighting the marginalization of the Global South and the need for a new, inclusive global order.

title: Dalai Lama's b'day under tree that grew from his walking stick
content: In Zemithang, Arunachal Pradesh, prayers marked the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday near the Gurusheng tree, grown from his staff left in 1959 during his escape from Tibet. Locals believe the staff took root, creating a holy tree that now bears fruit.

title: PSBs may remove min balance fines
content: Following finance ministry concerns over declining low-cost deposits, several public sector banks, including Canara Bank and Punjab National Bank, are scrapping minimum balance penalties on savings accounts. This policy shift, influenced by Jan Dhan account data and SBI's earlier move, aims to boost CASA deposits. Banks will now recover costs through alternative fees like debit card charges.

title: Now, RJD, Moitra & PUCL move Supreme Court
content: Several parties, including the TMC and PUCL, have petitioned the Supreme Court against the Election Commission's special intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls. They argue the revision is illegal and designed to disenfranchise Bihar's migrant workers. The petitioners claim the order unlawfully shifts the burden of proving eligibility onto citizens and excludes commonly accepted identity documents.

title: Amid import fears, govt to review protection for homegrown apples
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal addressed concerns about rising apple imports, stating the government will review protections for domestic growers while balancing consumer needs. This comes amid US demands for lower tariffs on agricultural goods. Goyal highlighted existing protections like a minimum import price and import duty, but acknowledged the need to ensure affordability for consumers.

title: Bihar bizman's killer identified; police probe jail & gangster links
content: Police investigating the murder of businessman Gopal Khemka in Patna have identified the shooter and are tracing his escape. Authorities are exploring connections to a Beur jail inmate and a possible link to a land dispute. The 2018 murder of Khemka's son is also under investigation, leading to jail raids, detentions, and the suspension of jail officials.

title: Dalai Lama's reincarnation our internal affair, says China
content: Tensions escalate as China's ambassador to India, Xu Feihong, dismisses the Dalai Lama's declaration regarding his reincarnation and criticizes Union minister Kiren Rijiju's support. Xu asserts that China opposes external interference in the reincarnation process, deeming it an internal affair. He emphasizes that the Chinese government holds the authority over religious status and titles.

title: On Mookerjee b'day, PM Modi pays tribute to India's 'immortal son'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi honored Syama Prasad Mookerjee on his birth anniversary, recognizing him as a national hero who sacrificed himself for India's unity. BJP President J P Nadda also paid tribute at Parliament. Modi emphasized Mookerjee's ideals are crucial for a developed India. Amit Shah highlighted Mookerjee's dedication to national integrity.

title: Pakistan's power struggle narrows to two men: Imran vs Munir
content: Pakistan's political arena is dominated by Army Chief Asim Munir, wielding influence across key institutions, and the imprisoned Imran Khan, who maintains strong public support. Khan has called for nationwide protests post-Muharram, challenging Munir's authority amidst rising public discontent. While Munir gains international recognition, Khan's movement thrives through a robust digital presence, potentially destabilizing the current power structure.

title: 'President Elon'? Musk launches 'America Party' after spat with Trump - is it viable?
content: Elon Musk has launched the "America Party," aiming to disrupt the two-party system and challenge what he calls a corrupt "uniparty." This move formalizes his growing feud with Trump, as Musk vows to fund challengers to Republican incumbents. Experts are skeptical, citing historical challenges faced by third parties, but acknowledge Musk's potential to reshape the GOP through primary challenges.

title: 4 killed as taxi plunges near Rohtang; flash floods ravage Himachal Pradesh
content: A tragic taxi accident near Rohtang Pass claimed four lives due to foggy conditions, while flash floods in Chamba and Mandi districts of Himachal Pradesh have caused widespread devastation, raising the monsoon death toll to 78 and resulting in significant infrastructure damage estimated at Rs 573 crore. Rescue operations are underway, and stranded tourists have been evacuated from Seraj valley.

title: Did Cardi B just dump Stefon Diggs? Rapper deletes all traces of NFL star after $12K-a-night castle romance
content: Cardi B has deleted all photos of Stefon Diggs from her Instagram. This action has led to speculation about a possible breakup. The couple's romance became public in June. Diggs still has photos of Cardi B on his profile. He recently took her on a romantic trip to a French castle.

title: J&K govt, biz seek 5% GST on handicraft items
content: The Jammu & Kashmir government is advocating for a reduction in the GST on handloom and handicraft products, including pashmina shawls and silk carpets, to make them more accessible to Indian consumers. Currently, a 12% tax is levied on items costing Rs 1,000 or more, and the proposal aims to lower it to 5% across all products.

title: Why Bilawal Bhutto's Masood, Hafiz extradition offer is a sham - no power, no trust
content: Amid strained relations, Pakistan's former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari surprisingly offered to extradite wanted terrorists if India cooperates legally. This comes after India put the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, a crucial resource for Pakistan. Experts view Bhutto's statement with skepticism, citing Pakistan's history of betrayals and Bhutto's lack of executive authority.

title: Wearing keffiyeh, Farooq Abdullah joins Muharram procession
content: Farooq Abdullah showed solidarity with Palestine and Iran during a Muharram procession in Srinagar, advocating for Muslim unity against tyranny. Simultaneously, L-G Manoj Sinha participated in a separate procession, emphasizing peace and selfless service. Shia leader Aga Syed Mohammad Hadi cautioned against arrests of Muharram participants, following reports of police action against provocative displays and violation of procession conditions.

title: 'My sister has cancer': Akash Deep's heartbreaking revelation
content: Akash Deep's exceptional bowling, claiming 10 wickets, propelled India to a historic Test victory over England at Edgbaston. He surpassed Chetan Sharma's record and became the second Indian pacer to achieve this feat in England. Dedicating his performance to his sister, who is battling cancer, Akash's emotional display fueled India's dominant 336-run win, their largest away from home.

title: Ahmedabad crash fallout: DGCA issues advisory; AI, IndiGo told to hold post-trauma workshops
content: Following the tragic AI 171 crash, the DGCA has directed Air India and IndiGo to conduct mental health workshops for flight crews due to the significant psychological impact. Pilots are particularly anxious due to the lack of a preliminary accident report, leading to increased stress and safety concerns.

title: Fog, bad weather affect heli-service for Vaishno Devi on 3rd consecutive day in Katra
content: Heli-services from Katra to Sanji Chhat remain suspended for the third consecutive day due to dense fog and adverse weather conditions in the Trikuta Hills. Pilgrims are resorting to trekking or using pony and palanquin services to reach the Bhawan.

title: Fifth batch of 7,208 Amarnath pilgrims departs from Jammu
content: A significant batch of 7,208 pilgrims embarked on the Shri Amarnath Yatra 2025 from Jammu, chanting "Bam Bam Bhole." Unfortunately, the journey faced a setback when a bus collision near Chanderkote injured 36 pilgrims due to brake failure. Despite the incident, the convoy of 310 vehicles continued under tight security towards the holy cave via Baltal and Pahalgam routes.

title: Akash Deep: The boy from Sasaram, who made England dance to his tunes at Edgbaston
content: Akash Deep didn‚Äôt get his desired conditions in England. Excited to bowl with the Dukes ball on a juicy pitch, he instead replaced Jasprit Bumrah on a placid Edgbaston track, but he adapted and rattled England in both innings. His dismissal of Joe Root in the second innings showcased his class and the hard yards he has put in on flat Indian pitches in the Ranji Trophy.

title: ‚ÄòStrongest terms‚Äô: Brics declaration slams Pahalgam attack, reaffirms stand against terror
content: BRICS nations strongly condemned the April 22 terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which resulted in 26 fatalities. The joint declaration, issued after the summit in Rio de Janeiro, labelled the attack as criminal and unjustifiable, advocating for united global action to eradicate terrorism in all forms. The bloc reaffirmed its commitment to zero tolerance, denouncing cross-border terrorism, financing, and safe havens, while rejecting double standards in counterterrorism efforts.

title: Sajad Lone alleges security withdrawal for coalition leaders after new alliance formed
content: Sajad Gani Lone, president of the People's Conference, alleged that security cover has been withdrawn from key leaders associated with the newly formed People's Alliance for Change. Lone highlighted criticism from across the LoC and threats from a militant outfit in Pakistan following the alliance's formation.

title: Record alert! India hand England their worst nightmare at Edgbaston
content: India achieved their largest away Test victory, defeating England by 336 runs at Edgbaston, leveling the series 1-1. This win marks India's first Test victory at the Birmingham venue, surpassing their previous record of 318 runs against West Indies in 2016. Akash Deep's impressive 6/99 led India's bowling attack, while Shubman Gill celebrated his first Test win as captain.

title: Army jawan dies in accidental firing in J&K's Rajouri
content: An army jawan, Naik Uppala Ravi Kumar from Andhra Pradesh, tragically died in an accidental firing incident in the Dharamsal area of Jammu & Kashmir's Rajouri district. According to official sources, the soldier's service rifle discharged unintentionally, causing critical injuries. Despite immediate medical attention from fellow soldiers, he succumbed to his injuries.

title: Desperate Search For Missing Girls As Texas Flood Death Rise To 78
content: Rescuers in Texas raced against time Sunday to find dozens of missing people, including children, swept away by flash floods that killed at least 78 people, with forecasters warning of new deluges.

title: "I Think It's Ridiculous": Donald Trump Mocks Elon Musk's 'America Party'
content: Elon Musk was almost inseparable from Trump as he headed the cost-cutting "Department of Government Efficiency," but they fell out hard over the president's "big beautiful" tax and spending mega-bill.

title: PM Modi's Scathing Attack On Pakistan At BRICS For Supporting Terror
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a scathing attack on Pakistan for supporting terrorism and thanked nations that stood with India in condemning the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Landslide Alert Issued For 4 Uttarakhand Districts Amid Heavy Rain Forecast
content: The State Emergency Operations Centre (SEOC) in Uttarakhand has issued a high-alert landslide warning for four districts-Tehri, Uttarkashi, Rudraprayag, and Chamoli.

title: Grand Celebrations Of Dalai Lama's 90th Birthday In Arunachal Pradesh
content: A grand celebration of the 90th birth anniversary of the Dalai Lama was celebrated across Arunachal Pradesh's Tawang and West Kameng districts.

title: 4 Killed, 1 injured As Car Falls Into Gorge In Manali: Police
content: Four people, including two tourists from Punjab, were killed on the spot, while one person sustained critical injuries when their vehicle skidded off a road and fell into a gorge near the Rani nallah.

title: "False": Police On Pune Techie's 'Rape By Delivery Agent' Complaint
content: The rape complaint lodged by a 22-year-old IT professional in Pune, who alleged that a 'delivery agent' had entered her flat and sprayed some chemical rendering her unconscious before committing the 'crime', was false, a top police officer said.

title: Insurgent From NSCN Faction Shot Dead In Encounter In Arunachal Pradesh
content: An insurgent of a faction of the NSCN was shot dead in a fierce encounter with a joint team of security forces in a thickly forested area in Arunachal Pradesh's Longding district.

title: China Used Embassies To Undermine Rafale Sales After India-Pakistan Tensions: Report
content: China deployed its embassies to spread doubts about the performance of French-made Rafale jets after they saw combat in India and Pakistan's clashes in May, French military and intelligence officials have concluded.

title: Reuters' X Account Unblocked In India After Government Intervention
content: International news agency Reuters' X account was withheld in India for a few hours but restored later on Sunday after the government intervened to say it had not sought the blocking of the handle.

title: BRICS Leaders Condemn Pahalgam Attack, Reject 'Double Standards' In Countering Terror
content: Leaders of the BRICS countries strongly condemned the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack while reaffirming their commitment to combatting cross-border movement of terrorists.

title: Northeast Region A Storehouse Of Critical Minerals, Centre Seeks To Unlock It
content: The government has identified several areas in the northeast region enriched with critical and strategic minerals which are important for clean energy transition, digital infrastructure and defence manufacturing, according to the GSI.

title: "Our Fight Is Only Against Imposition Of Hindi In Primary Education": Sanjay Raut
content: Amid an ongoing political row over the alleged "imposition" of Hindi in Maharashtra's primary education, Sanjay Raut clarified that their party is not against the Hindi language, but opposes making it mandatory in primary schooling.

title: Maharashtra To Blacklist Farmers Using Fake Crop Insurance Claims: Report
content: The Maharashtra government has decided to blacklist farmers found submitting fake crop insurance claims, an action largely limited to intermediaries and service providers earlier, a senior official from the state agriculture department said.

title: BJP MLA's Son Charged For Firing Gun In Air At Karnataka Temple Fair
content: Santosh Jarkiholi, son of BJP MLA and former minister Ramesh Jarkiholi, has been booked after a video emerged showing him allegedly firing a gun in the air during a temple fair in Gokak.

title: 23 Flash Floods, 19 Cloud Bursts Amid Heavy Downpour In Himachal Pradesh
content: The heavy downpour in Himachal Pradesh has wreaked havoc, with the state reporting 23 flash floods, followed by 19 cloud burst incidents and 16 landslides till today.

title: Kerala Woman Forest Officer Rescues Her First King Cobra In 6 Minutes
content: Beat Forest Officer G S Roshni, who has rescued over 800 venomous and non-poisonous snakes in her nearly eight-year-long career in the Kerala Forest Department, took only a few minutes to bag a 14-15 feet long king cobra.

title: Elderly Couple Killed In Hit-And-Run On Pune Highway, Captured In CCTV: Cops
content: An elderly couple was killed in a suspected hit-and-run accident on the Pune-Solapur Highway near Bhigwan in Pune district on Sunday morning, a police official from Pune Rural Police said.

title: Himanta Sarma Launches 'Bodoland Speaks' To Promote Peace In Region
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma inaugurated 'Bodoland Speaks: From Vision to Action', an initiative under Bodoland Happiness Mission.

title: "Immature Political Child": Imran Khan's Party's Big Attack On Bilawal Bhutto
content: Describing former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari as an "immature political child," Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party has slammed him for suggesting Islamabad could extradite "individuals of concern" to India as a confidence-building measure.

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Piastri penalty: Did stewards' inconsistency cost him British GP win?
content: Oscar Piastri has claimed his first ever victory at the British Grand Prix . he responded to countless questions about the 10-second penalty that cost him victory . but he refused to elaborate on the true feelings no doubt seething inside . his ebullient teammate, race winner lando norris, had to wait alone for 25 minutes .

title: Messi's brilliant brace helps Miami rout Montreal
content: Inter Miami beat CF Montreal 4-1 in their first MLS game in over a month . Lionel Messi scored twice to help the hosts to a 4-1 win . the hosts were eliminated last week in a 4-0 defeat to Paris saint-Germain .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Orioles' lineup gets a boost; Chapman set to return for Giants
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the Sunday afternoon slate is lighter than usual with three evening affairs, including two evening affairs . first is at 6:10 p.m. ET in Wrigley Field with the Chicago Cubs hosting the St. Louis Cardinals and the San Diego Padres entertaining the Texas Rangers .

title: Jim√©nez pays tribute to Jota after Gold Cup goal
content: Mexico  striker  Ra√∫l Jim√©nez  paid tribute to former teammate  Diogo Jota  after scoring a goal against the  United States  at the  Gold Cup . Jota was killed along with his brother, Andr√© Silva, in a car crash near Zamora, Spain, in the early hours of Thursday morning. Jim√©nez, who played two seasons at  Wolverhampton Wanderers  with Jota from 2018 to 2020, scored in the 27th minute and during his celebration grabbed a Mexico jersey showing Jota's name and his No. 20 on the back before taking a seat on the field and showing the shirt to the cameras. The services for Jota and his brother were held Saturday morning in Gondomar, Portugal. During Saturday's news conference ahead of the match, Jim√©nez said Jota was a "great teammate who was with me for two years there at Wolves, with whom I regularly kept in touch. "We shared very beautiful moments." Mexico went on to win the game 2-1 to lift its 10th Gold Cup title.

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: if any of these thoughts come true, don't be surprised . if a fantasy season comes true, it's a legitimately valuable fantasy season for sure . it was his first game back in the lineup, his first time playing since the first week of the season.

title: ‚ÄôUngaludan Stalin‚Äô camps to be conducted from July 15
content: Two camps will be held in each of the 200 wards from July 15 to October 31, with about 2,000 volunteers

title: Hiring of doctors at evening clinics in health and wellness centres improves patronage
content: As doctors from urban primary health centres visit hospitals only during the day, residents want the GCC to open more such evening clinics

title: L-G Sinha, Union Minister Goyal pay tributes to Syama Prasad on 124th birth anniversary in Kashmir
content: L-G Sinha said Mookerjee sacrificed his life for unification of J&K with India and was a proponent of ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Constitution, One Symbol‚Äô and opposed Article 370

title: RSS discusses religious conversions, demographic 'imbalances' during 3-day meet
content: The RSS will complete 100 years of its foundation on Vijayadashmi which will be celebrated this year on October 2.

title: PM Modi meets Cuban President; discuss ties in pharma, UPI on sidelines of BRICS
content: The two leaders agreed to work on issues of concern to the global South, including in the areas of health, pandemics and climate change.

title: Study links air pollution to preterm births, low birth weight in India
content: The study has also found that Bihar, Haryana, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh bear the brunt of the reproductive consequences of bad air

title: Bengaluru to get 4,500 electric buses under PM e-Drive scheme
content: The CESL tender, issued last month, aims to procure, operate, and maintain 10,900 electric buses across five major cities, with Bengaluru alone slated to receive the largest share

title: 105 booked for drunk driving in Hyderabad, fines worth ‚Çπ2.39 lakh imposed
content: These persons were arrested from Abids, Chikkadpally and Saifabad were counselled before being presented in court.

title: Bodoland‚Äôs indigenous groups face demographic threat: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma underlines the unprecedented stability across the poll-bound Bodoland Territorial Region since he took over

title: Heavy rainfall alert for seven Telangana districts on July 7
content: According to IMD‚Äôs latest bulletin, heavy rainfall is very likely at isolated places in Adilabad, Kumaram Bheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal, Nizamabad, Jayashankar Bhupalpally and Mulugu districts.

title: Lokesh lauds teachers for enrolling their children in government schools
content: Minister for Human Resources Development (HRD) Nara Lokesh on Sunday praised government schoolteachers, who are not only promoting public education but also enrolling their own children in government schools.

title: Congress alleges rigging in Haryana Assistant Professor recruitment exams; seeks re-conduct and judicial probe
content: Addressing the delegation of the candidates appearing for the Assistant Professor exam, former Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda said that ‚Äúpaper leaks, copy-paste exams and scams have become synonymous with the recruitments conducted under the BJP government‚Äù.

title: Himachal rains: Cloudbursts in Mandi, Chamba; woman swept away in Hamirpur
content: Since the onset of monsoon on June 20, the state has reported 78 deaths, of which 50 were linked to rain-related incidents such as cloudbursts, flash floods and landslips.

title: There should be no hesitation in imposing sanctions against terrorists: PM Modi at BRICS
content: "From West Asia to Europe, today the world is surrounded by disputes and tensions. The humanitarian situation in Gaza is a cause of great concern," he said.

title: Stipends still unpaid as 64 MBBS interns remain suspended by Telangana private medical college
content: As per a 2023 Government Order, MBBS interns in Telangana, whether in government or private medical colleges are entitled to a monthly stipend of ‚Çπ25,906

title: Telangana Health department warns of surge in monsoon illnesses
content: People urged to keep homes mosquito-free, drink only filtered or boiled water and avoid outside food to keep infections at bay

title: A sea of grief, faith and ritual: thousands join Muharram procession in Hyderabad‚Äôs Old City
content: The juloos commenced shortly after 1 pm from the Bibi Ka Alawa in Dabeerpura, a centuries-old mourning house regarded as one of Telangana‚Äôs most significant centres of devotion of the Shia community

title: Reuters' X account unblocked in India after govt. intervention
content: The government asked the Elon Musk-owned platform for an explanation and said it had not sought such a move

title: National Commission for Minorities awaiting appointment of Chairperson, members
content: Five members of the commission, including the Chairperson, have retired since December 2024, with no new appointments having been made so far

title: The Eye Foundation launches 25th hospital in Chennai
content: A state-of-the-art eye care facility begins operations at Vadapalani, serving Chennai and nearby regions

title: Congress gets its Assam unit election-ready, carries out massive reshuffle
content: The elaborate exercise, undertaken after the appointment of Lok Sabha member Gaurav Gogoi as State Congress chief, is also an attempt by the party to project a unified face

title: AIADMK will get absolute majority in 2026 Assembly poll: Palaniswami
content: Ahead of his state-wide tour, to begin in Coimbatore on July 7, he says people of Tamil Nadu want change and are preparing to send home the DMK government

title: Two-thirds of humanity still lack proper representation in 20th century global institutions: PM Modi
content: BRICS Leaders Declaration includes explicit condemnation of Pahalgam attack, cross-border terror; calls for UNSC reform; supports Palestinians‚Äô right to an independent State; slams attack on Iran

title: Cookd, a home-cooking start-up, raises ‚Çπ16 crore of funding in Pre-Series A Round
content: Apart from posting online cooking videos, Cookd offers a wide range of products ranging from biryani kits, masalas, cooking pastes, and ready-to-use recipe kits

title: Over 500 dogs vaccinated at NTR vet hospital on World Zoonosis Day
content: Timely vaccination of domestic animals and maintaining hygiene will help prevent transmission of diseases from animals to humans, says Special Chief Secretary B. Rajasekhar

title: Kolkata‚Äôs scream
content: Less than a year after the rape and murder of a doctor at R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital created a nationwide outrage, another allegation of sexual assault inside a law college has shaken the people of Kolkata once more.¬†Moyurie Som, Shrabana Chatterjee,¬†and¬†Shiv Sahay Singh¬†look at how safe women in West Bengal‚Äôs Capital feel, in the city with India‚Äôs lowest reported crime against women for some years now

title: IIIT-B student gets record ‚Çπ1.45 crore package as institute celebrates silver jubilee convocation
content: This was announced during the Silver Jubilee Convocation Ceremony held on the IIIT-B campus, where 372 students graduated across various programmes

title: 16 booked for breaking barricades during Muharram procession in Ujjain
content: Police say incident was pre-planned; several personnel injured as ceremonial horse collapses after barricade breach

title: 36 lakh school kits, sans political branding, distributed to students in State
content: Named Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan Vidyarthi Mithra Kits, they have undergone a three-stage quality check before distribution, and cost govt. ‚Çπ953.71 crore

title: No immediate danger to Srisailam dam gates, says expert
content: Stating that leakage is less than 10% from gate No. 10, A.P. Govt. Advisor Kannaiah Naidu suggests repair and repainting of gates and proper maintenance to extend their life

title: Palakkad, Malappuram administrations step up vigil against Nipah
content: 383 persons in the State are under observation, says Health Minister. Additional ICU and isolation facilities set up in Palakkad, Malappuram and Kozhikode to prepare for a potential surge in patients

title: Rayaraddi says media distorted his remarks on guarantee schemes, infrastructure funding
content: This comes after he indicated that the govt. is facing difficulty in funding infrastructure projects due to the large outlay for guarantee schemes

title: Environment impact study for Great Nicobar project downplays earthquake risk
content: Report says the probability of another mega earthquake, such as the one that led to the 2004 tsunami, is ‚Äòlow‚Äô; however, an IIT-Kanpur report had pointed to uncertainty in ‚Äòprediction of future earthquakes‚Äô;¬†professor who led the IIT study urges infra planners to conduct ‚Äòsite-specific study‚Äô

title: CPI(M) directs rank and file to defend Veena George

title: Chief Election Commissioner defends SIR in Bihar, ECI says no change in instructions

title: Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy heading to Delhi to push for early clearances of pending projects

title: Justice Chandrachud clarifies extended stay at official residence not indefinite

title: Geo-tube along Narsapuram coast to be commissioned by October

title: Atomic energy board grants operational licence to two home-built 700 MWe reactors in Gujarat

title: Possession of suspected leopard tooth: Union Minister Suresh Gopi to be summoned

Future course of action will be decided after obtaining his statement, says an officer
